result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Merissa L Kelsey was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $75/month commencing September 1, 2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Def in person & by Atty Victor E Plantinga.  Atty Mark Bensen appeared for State.  Defendant has successfully completed the TAD Program.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Sentencing hearing at 06-15-2016 09:45 am

Def in person & by Atty Victor E Plantinga.  Atty. Mark Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached with TAD recommendation; both sides free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Counsel requests an adjourned date to early June 2016 for sentencing.  Recommendation upon successful completion of TAD and no future bail jump charges:  25 days jail with Huber; $1,618 fine;  DNA sample; $60 blood draw fee; 18 mo. DL revocation; 18 mo. ignition interlock; AODA.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Court admonishes Defendant of bond conditions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
